column1: '''Jack Arthur Walter Bennett''' ([[28 February]] [[1911]]â€“ [[29 January]] [[1981]]) was a New Zealand-born literary scholar. He is best known as a scholar of Middle English literature, and as a fellow [[Inklings
column2: Inkling]] with [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]. Bennett succeeded [[C.S. Lewis]] as Professor of Medieval and Renaissance Literature at Magdalene College, Cambridge.
